column4: hello! I don't like rythmbox much... Could you please suggest me some other music library mgmt application to try out? It needs to run under gnome... thank you!
install amaroK
: I'd like to, but I don't feel like installing tons of kde libs...
it's worth it
besides, then you can use K3B too :)
why not switch to kubuntu, then? :-)
those two apps alone are worth putting the kde libs, so you can still run gnome but have the two best "other" apps
because KDE sucks
could you please give me a hint about how do I get amarok to play mp3 files? It seems to be a codec problem, or something like that
hmmm, you already have all the codecs?
well, rythmbox and xmms and beep-media-player work fine, so I guess so
then you shouldn't need anything else, let me look at mine...
I don't see anything in particular to configure in amaroK for mp3, and IIRC there was nothing to do but install it and fire it up.
anybody else here have a pointer for amarok and mp3's?
did you install amarok or amarok-gstreamer ?
just amarok
hmm let me try, then, I went for amarok-gstreamer
necrophilia?
lemme know what happens
sure I will
very strange. apt-getting amarok leads to the install of the very same packages as did amarok-gstreamer, yet this time it works out of the box
btw, did you also manage to have amarok retrieve an mp3 details by using musicbrainz? For every file I try, it says it can't find it in the musicbrainz database... Thanks!
amarok has it's own database IIRC
